result.execSummary:
The defendant David F Sippel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs of Count 1 shall be paid as a condition of probation in Count 2.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Court authorizes transfer to county jail convenient to employment or residence.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: Costs for Count 1 shall be paid as a condition of probation in Count 2.   If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then take medication as prescribed.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David F Sippel

State moves to amend to 2 Counts of Negligent Handling of a Dangerous Weapon-941.20(1)(a), Court grants the amendment.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1 and Count 2 as amended.  Court accepts the plea to Count 1 and Count 2 as amended.  Eva I. makes statements.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

Counsel advises the defendant did not appear on Mpnday as there was confusion that the case was pushed out along with the municipal case and then turned self in today.  Court orders $5,000.00 signature bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 09:45 am.
